example: There are 60 seconds in a minute. / He came second in the race.
The primacy of education in national development is emphasized.

chinese: 令人满足的；使人有成就感的
example: Teaching is a fulfilling career for many people.
The new policy will have a big impact on the economy. / The car crash had a strong impact.
Negative thoughts can affect your mood. / The answer to the question is negative.
Meeting others’ expectations can be stressful. / The expectation of rain made us cancel the picnic.
Adolescents often face many challenges. / The adolescent boy is going through a growth spurt.
He bought the car on an impulse. / Resisting impulse buying can save money.
He clumsily dropped the vase. / The child walked clumsily in big shoes.
She is keenly interested in art. / He keenly observed the changes in the market.
Hard work deserves a good reward. / The reward for his effort was a promotion.
Teenagers often compare themselves with peers. / She values the opinions of her peers.
He is not lazy; in other words, he just needs more motivation.
We all go through difficult times. / The teacher will go through the exam papers.
Math is my favorite subject. / The subject of the meeting is education. / In grammar, the subject comes before the verb.
Let’s consider a hypothetical situation. / The question is based on a hypothetical case.
They argue about politics all the time. / She argues that the plan will work.
Don’t mention the surprise party. / He mentioned his trip to Japan.
Completing college applications can be time-consuming. / She is working on her college applications.
Pay attention in class to learn better. / He didn’t pay attention to the warning signs.
Missing classes can affect your grades. / He missed classes due to illness.
Some students drop out of school for various reasons. / He decided to drop out of the competition.
Many adolescents have low self-confidence at times. / She works to help those who have low self-confidence.
Lack of motivation can lead to poor performance. / A good reward system boosts motivation.
She has a degree in engineering. / The temperature rose by two degrees. / To some degree, he is right.
Preparing for entrance exams requires hard work. / He did well in the college entrance exams.
The store sells a variety of art supplies. / She bought new art supplies for her class.
He struggles to finish his homework on time. / Many people struggle to make ends meet.
